sanskrit_verse:
यानि राजप्रदेयानि प्रत्यहं ग्रामवासिभिः ।
अन्नपानेन्धनादीनि ग्रामिकस्तान्यवाप्नुयात् ॥ ७.११८॥
transliteration:
yāni rājapradeyāni pratyahaṁ grāmavāsibhiḥ |
annapānendhanādīni grāmikas tāny avāpnuyāt || 7.118 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those resources which are to be provided daily by the villagers under royal directive—such as food, drink, fuel, and other essentials—the village headman shall obtain them without obstruction or personal appropriation.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from the sovereign to the administrative steward without personal claim
Causation is maintained through uninterrupted provision of communal necessities
Capacity-based responsibility requires the Gramika to act as conduit, not accumulator
Restoration logic demands that essential supplies reach intended recipients unaltered
Consciousness alignment occurs when duty is fulfilled without egoic interference
executable_legal_axioms: IF a Gramika obstructs or diverts royal provisions → THEN realign capacity via supervised distribution
IF daily essentials are not delivered → THEN initiate completion process with community oversight
IF personal accumulation is detected → THEN restore integrity through public restitution protocol
IF causality in supply chain breaks → THEN reassign authority until continuity resumes
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that local administrators hold delegated authority, not ownership. The threshold of responsibility lies in ensuring seamless transmission of state-provided resources. Any deviation triggers automatic review and restoration protocols rather than punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa shows clear causal flow from sovereign will to citizen welfare. Anupūrvaśaḥ confirms sequential duty fulfillment: villager gives, Gramika receives, recipient benefits. Responsibility is proportional to role; misalignment invites correction, not condemnation. Reality remains non-punitive as consciousness recalibrates through structured restoration.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Re-delivery of undelivered items within 24 hours under witness
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Public declaration of error and corrective timeline
Capacity Restoration: Temporary supervision until trust and function are re-established
Integrity Reintegration: Community audit and reaffirmation of service oath
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Dharma stands restored. Provision flows unhindered. Consciousness governs all adjudication. There is no punishment—only alignment.
